author: Guest (Guest)

author: admin
title: To: poematrix
text: Make sure you use java 1.6 or newer.

author: admin
title: Admin
text: OSX version working now, was a packaging issue.

author: admin
title: My 2 cents.
text:
The OSX versions has multiple issues, and there are other problems I need to fix: see [[Changelog]]
Might be a couple of days.

author: admin
title: Admin
text: Will dbl check on that (I have a mac avail), I'm using netbeans built-in mac target which i thought would work.

author: Guest (Guest)
title: Mac OS X
text: Mac version doesn't work. The download contains just a Contents folder. It needs to be a .app folder to work as an app. Tried putting Contents inside a fansuite.app folder but no go.

author: admin
title: Admin
text:
Sorry i didn't see those messages until now.
Please try the new version.
If it still doesn't work, please send me an email tcolar AT colar.net with the log (/home/me/.fansuite/dev/var/log/messages.log), i suppose under windows it's in the user folder as well (or just search for fansuite)

author: Guest (Guest)
title: Same problem
text: I have the same problem as poematrixs, I can not get the IDE to recognize my Fan installation. Awaiting next release.

author: poematrix (Guest)
title: Sorry, I forgot to refresh the page ...
text: The OS is XP/Professional. If you want to send me your email address, I'll email me you a screenshot of what it looks like.

author: Admin (Guest)
title: Fan options
text:
The fan options panel does not show ?
That sounds odd, i don't have this problem.
What OS is that on ?

author: poematrix (Guest)
title: Fan tab does not work
text:
I attempted setting up the path to my Fan installation. I assume that must be dong in the "Fan" tab of the settings dialog. However, clicking the "fan" tab does not produce any visible results. Whichever tab had been displayed before clicking on "Fan" continues to be displayed thereafter.
Any work-around? Have I overlooked something?
TIA,
poematrixs
